intro: Potentilla sylvestris var. fleischmannii, commonly known as the Fleischmann's cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features small, yellow, five-petaled flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are palmately divided into five narrow, lance-shaped lobes. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine environments.
